title: ESA tips for 1st Sem
content: How to study for ESA and is there anything to be warned against?

comments.body: Don't skip any concepts, they can create a question from any area

It'll be just like any other pen and paper exam you've written before. There are no optional questions, so you need to prepare for all concepts and also attempt everything. Manage your time well since papers here can get very lengthy. Don't skip anything - things like derivations are as important as the concepts themselves. Make sure you go through the textbook for each course as well
Partial grading is allowed. Make use of it if you're stuck somewhere. Sleep well before your exam day
